intro: Allionia melanotricha, commonly known as the black-haired allionia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its distinctive dark purple to black bracts that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Allionia melanotricha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique foliage.
